newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin falls to 24-1/2 mth low on London's drop.
newsitem.headline: KL tin falls to 24-1/2 mth low on London's drop.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price fell seven cents to close at a 24-1/2-month low of 14.03 ringgit ($5.60) a kg, pressured by an $80-drop on the London Metal Exchange (LME) last Friday, traders said.
The closing price on Monday was the lowest since March 22, 1995 when it closed at 13.92.
Traders said further direction would depend on the performance of the London market, but they expect immediate support at the 14.00 ringgit level.
"We didn't fall as much as LME as there was some support at around the 14 ringgit level," said one local trader.
Turnover was 117 tonnes, up from 81 on Friday, and was absorbed by European and local buyers.
The local price premium over LME has widened to $135 a tonne from $85 previously, the traders said.
